translation.content: It is an invitation to rediscover a refined, sensual, and benevolent art of living. Far from the constraints of time, it is a time of eternal summer where every detail counts.
is an invitation to rediscover a refined, subtle, generous, timeless art of living, in a world where every detail counts and every moment is savored.
The art of taste. The elegance of living.
The DNA of beauty and goodness!

An obvious partnership unites Olivia and Philippe Veran. Two distinct areas of expertise from two brilliant entrepreneurs who, over the years, have combined to create a world of smiles and offer unique places of well-being and escape.

Together, we aim to offer over 4,000 square meters of happiness, experiences, and indulgence, as well as unique pieces crafted by the hands and minds of ingenious artisans. Every space within our establishment is designed to transport and inspire our guests. Our hospitality, dining, and pastry offerings are crafted by our renowned chefs and partners.

Yazid Ichemrahen, French Pastry Champion at 19, European Champion at 21, and World Champion at 22, is a genius of pure talent, one of the most renowned pastry chefs of his generation. His personal story has forged his taste for hard work; he is a virtuoso of detail, creating flavors that transport you.

Alexandre Lechêne, a Michelin-starred chef at only 31, hails from Saint-Véran (the Véran family saw it as a sign of destiny!). He is a culinary genius, dedicated to meticulous craftsmanship, and a lover of local produce, showcasing wild plants and regional specialties.

Kondah Abdessamad, after honing his skills in the restaurants of major Moroccan hotel chains (Sofitel, Radisson Blue, Atlantic Palace) and more recently working in prestigious establishments such as Le Malak Emeraude or La Sonate, has decided to join the NASHIRA @ SPA team of excellence to manage the hotel's two restaurants under the close collaboration of chefs Alexandre and Yazid!

Born into a family of skilled craftsmen, Maxime Peysson was immersed in the trade from a young age. Trained to the highest standards at the Coubertin Foundation and by the finest artisans in France and Europe, he succeeded his father after his sudden passing. Accustomed to creating exquisite spaces (jewelry stores, luxury pastry shops, luxury hotels, and sporting events), Maxime joined the Elegance Epicurian group in September 2025 to draw inspiration from the best in their respective fields.

is a Michelin-starred gastronomic restaurant, where the full talent of our Chef Alexandre Lechêne is on display. His cuisine is based on strong links with local artisans, market gardeners and fishermen and is distinguished by the pure and gourmet expression of Mediterranean flavors and also by some sublime desserts by Yazid Ichemrahen.

We also offer a refined bistro, Atelier Salone, which has been awarded a Michelin star and a Bib Gourmand. Its simple yet sophisticated menu offers a delightful experience, accessible and quick enough for a lunch break, a business meal, or a family gathering with friends.
Our 250 5* hotels spread across Italy and France, as well as our 4* star elements 5* hotels located in the center of the most prestigious cities and in the most paradisiacal places in the world.
The terroir, we find a start on the roofs and the land, rare wines that celebrate the regional gastronomic history, enriched by a passion for authentic flavors.
Imagine a city center where a family home combines authenticity and modernity. Every bite tells a story, every dish evokes a memory linked to this generous and comforting cuisine.
In the heart of Split, a hotel where the old meets the new. A place where Mediterranean charm blends with sophisticated contemporary design. A hidden gem where every stay becomes a journey...
© Élégance Épicurean Group 2025. All rights reserved.

In the heart of Salon-de-Provence, on the famous Place de la Fontaine Moussue, the entire team at Trattoria Salone awaits you. This Italian trattoria offers dishes created by Chef Alexandre Lechêne, a Michelin-starred chef at Villa Salone, whose cuisine evokes the flavors of Italy, from Sicily to Lombardy. He has crafted the menu, which is based on his inspiration and the seasons, with some desserts created by Yazid Ichemrahen.

A place, an experience… find yourself at the home of a world-renowned pastry chef and savor pasta with caviar or a revisited Wagyu beef tartare! A simple menu, full of flavors that each evoke an experience, a memory for our chef, perfect for lunches, afternoon teas, dinners, brunches, after-work drinks, and cocktails in a cozy atmosphere.

A workshop for creating and making pastries, cakes, ice cream, and chocolates, with chef Yazid Ichemrahen. The simplicity of authentic taste, made possible by the exclusive use of exceptional raw materials without altering their natural qualities. The desire to share my world with everyone, to evoke forgotten childhood flavors, to create an emotional experience.

A different kind of adventure in an enchanting location in the heart of the Medina in Marrakech. A 17-room Riad completely renovated, refurnished, redesigned with many new features: Bar, restaurant, solarium, large jacuzzi, rooftop gym as well as a new space offering even higher views over the rooftops of Marrakech to enjoy a cognac and a cigar while watching the sunset over the Atlas Mountains. A place imagined by lovers of Morocco - an unprecedented encounter between the Veran family and Teddy Riner that gave life to an exceptional place.
Would you like to join the team?
Please feel free to contact us with any further questions.

Peysson Créations — carpentry & woodwork of art in Aubagne (13) — imagines, manufactures and installs custom-made doors, windows, shutters and fittings, from new construction to heritage restoration, in an elegant simplicity: matches, exceptional residences, shops, hotels, restaurants... Peysson Créations will study your wildest projects.
You are currently connected to the Elegance Epicurean Group website.
Company name: Upperside Capital Partners Group
Registered office: 36 rue des Petits Champs – 75002 Paris
Secondary establishment: 479 Boulevard Maréchal Foch – 13300 Salon de Provence – France

The products, product names, or service names, logos, images, videos, documents… and any other distinctive signs of Upperside and its companies, which are displayed on the site are protected by French, European or any other applicable law.
Any unauthorized use or reproduction is strictly prohibited.

This website contains links to third-party websites (“external links”). These websites are the responsibility of their respective operators. The presence of external links on this website does not imply that the Upperside Group endorses the content linked to by hyperlinks. When the links were first created, the Upperside Group verified that the content associated with the external links did not violate applicable laws. At that time, no legal violations were found. The Upperside Group has no influence on the current or future design or content of the linked pages. However, should the Upperside Group become aware of a legal violation, it will remove the relevant links as soon as possible.

Given the development of new communication tools, it is essential to pay particular attention to the protection of privacy. The Upperside Group, as data controller, is committed to respecting the confidentiality of the personal information it collects and the applicable legislation regarding the processing of personal data, in particular the European General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (“GDPR”). This policy (along with our general terms and conditions of sale) aims to inform you of our practices concerning the collection, use, and sharing of information that you provide to us through our platform accessible from the website http://groupe-upperside.com/ (hereinafter referred to as the “Site”). It describes how we process the personal data we collect and that you provide to us. We recommend that you read it carefully.
When you use our Site, you may provide us with information, some of which can identify you ("Personal Data"). This may include, in particular:

-Data relating to your use of our online services. Our online services collect browsing data that may identify your device when you access or browse our Site. In this context, we may collect the IP address of the device connected to the Internet, the type of browser and operating system used, as well as other automatically processed data such as your Internet service provider, the website from which you accessed our Site, the number of pages viewed on our Site, your use of our Site, the time spent on each page of our Site, etc. This data may be used to ensure the operation of our Site, the provision of our services, and to track and analyze Site traffic. This section provides examples of personal data that we may collect on our Site and the possible uses of this personal data. If you do not wish us to collect your personal data, please do not provide it to us, do not use our services, and do not access our Site. With your prior consent, we may transmit your personal data to our business partners, members of the Upperside group.

The controller of your personal data is: Upperside, a company with a capital of 10,000,000 euros, whose registered office is located at 36 rue des Petits Champs, 75002 Paris – France, registered with the Paris Trade and Companies Register under number 403 123 011, whose intra-community VAT number is FR 1140312301100021, whose contact email address is contact@groupe-upperside.com and whose telephone number is 04 90 44 60 60. Our data protection officer is Secure 4 ALL.

Passive data collection: When you visit and interact with our Site, personal data may be collected passively, as you may not be aware that the data in question is being collected during these visits or interactions. The information collected may include, but is not limited to, the following: IP address of Site visitors, information related to IP address, MAC (Media Access Control) address of the system, network configuration information, etc. We also use "cookie" technology to collect anonymous information about visitors. Cookies are alphanumeric identifiers that are transferred to the user's computer hard drive via their web browser. By doing so, we can personalize your future visits and save you time while browsing. You can prevent cookies from being used in your browser by disabling this feature.

Direct Collection: We may also collect data from you when you provide us with information through the Site. For example, if you contact us to request products and services, ask questions, or provide feedback or comments about the Site or our products and services, we may record the information you provide, including any personal data, in order to efficiently process your request. If you do not wish your personal data to be collected directly, please do not provide it to us.

Personal data collected on our Site is archived for 5 years after the last use of our Site, without prejudice to any legal obligations or statutes of limitations. It is retained for 3 years for marketing and promotional purposes. Certain categories of personal data may be retained for different periods, particularly financial data, which is kept for the period required by applicable tax and accounting laws. For accounting purposes, it is kept for 10 years from the end of the financial year.

We use the data we collect to:
-- Improve and optimize our Platforms, in particular to ensure that our content is displayed correctly on your device; processing based on our legitimate interest (providing you with relevant content),
- Help us maintain a healthy and secure environment on our Platforms: processing based on our legitimate interest (ensuring the security of our Platforms), necessary for compliance with our legal obligations and/or necessary for the establishment, exercise or defense of legal claims.

When required by law or regulation, we will request your consent before sharing your information. However, in some cases, your consent is granted as part of the contract between us. Your personal data is intended for Upperside Group companies, their service providers based in the European Union or in third countries, and, where applicable, their partners. We commit to not selling, renting, or disclosing your personal data to other entities without your consent or if you have objected to such disclosure.

In accordance with Articles 15 to 22 of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) of April 27, 2016, and subject to meeting the conditions set out in these articles, you have the right to:
– access all of your personal data; – rectify inaccurate and/or incomplete data; – obtain the erasure of your data. Subject to proof of your identity, and where technically feasible, you have the right to request the portability of your personal data. You may also request that processing be restricted and object, at any time, to the processing of this data for reasons relating to your particular situation. However, the data controller may refuse your request if they demonstrate compelling legitimate grounds which override the interests, rights, and freedoms of the data subject, or for the establishment, exercise, or defense of legal claims. The data controller indicates that this right to object can also be exercised by the user when the data is processed solely for marketing purposes. Furthermore, when the processing is based solely on the user's consent, the user may withdraw that consent at any time. To exercise these rights, you can notify us by mail or email at: 35 rue des Petits Champs – 75002 Paris – France or by email at: contact@groupe-upperside.com.

We are committed to ensuring the security of the data you provide to us. To prevent any unauthorized access, use, modification, destruction, loss, damage, or disclosure, and to protect the data collected, appropriate technical and organizational measures have been implemented. The personal data we collect is stored in a secure environment. Our employees are required to respect the confidentiality of your information. To ensure the security of your personal data, we use the following measures: • SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) protocol, • Data backup. We are committed to maintaining a high level of confidentiality by integrating the latest technological innovations to ensure the privacy of your transactions. However, as no mechanism offers absolute security, a degree of risk is always present when the internet is used to transmit personal information. In the event of a personal data breach, we are obligated to notify the competent supervisory authority and to inform you, as soon as possible, of any personal data breach likely to result in a high risk to your rights and freedoms, so that you can take appropriate action.
9. Transfer of personal data outside the European Union

As a general rule, we store your Personal Data within the European Union. If, in certain cases, your personal data needs to be transferred outside the European Union, we ensure that this transfer is carried out in accordance with applicable regulations and guarantees a sufficient level of protection for privacy and fundamental rights.

The Site and our business may evolve. Therefore (and for other business and/or technological reasons), we may modify this Privacy Policy. We reserve the right to update, alter, amend, or modify this Privacy Policy at any time and as appropriate, without prior notice. We encourage you to review this policy regularly, and especially before providing any personal data. If we believe that the planned changes constitute a major revision of this Privacy Policy, we will post a notice on the Site to inform users of these changes and allow them to take certain actions before the changes take effect. In some cases, we may also send an email to notify registered users of the upcoming changes. This Privacy Policy was last updated on the date indicated above. Your continued use of the Sites after any changes or revisions to this Privacy Policy have been implemented constitutes acceptance of the revised Policy as it now applies.
